column1: short of a length, angles into him, and he goes on to the back foot and defends
fuller, straighter, and he presses forwrad to defend
zips into him from a fuller length, and he plays forward to this. Goes off the inside part of his bat and pops up, but lands where a short leg might have been (but isn't)
leans forward to guide a length ball outside off. Third slip dives across to his right and saves it
full, straight, and he defends
full, slants in, and he leans forward to defend
length, just outside off, and Ahmadi leans forward to defend
length, a bit of swing away, and he presses forward to defend
length, outside off, lifting further away, and he shoulders arms
good ball! Angles in, nips away from a good length, and Ahmadi plays it with soft hands off the outside edge, and gets it past gully for the first runs of this Test
swing away from just a little back of a length. Zadran is happy to leave
length, seams away and he leaves
length ball around off, angling in. Ahmadi works it away towards square leg
fuller around off, drives it on the off side where extra cover fails to cut it off and that allows Zadran to get off the mark with a couple
length ball around off, defended on the off side
length ball, at the stumps this time. Stays back and blocks
length outside off, stays back and plays it late towards covers
fuller around off, looks to drive but gets it away in front of square leg from the inner half of the bat
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
length ball in the channel, a bit of wobble but left alone without any fuss
fuller this time, much closer to the batsman as well, who comes forward and blocks
fuller again, a hint of movement away. Defends it towards extra cover with a straight bat
fuller outside off, looks to block but gets a thick outside edge rolling towards cover-point
fuller outside off, pushes through covers for a single
fuller outside off, a big stride in and driven handsomely with a high elbow though covers for the first boundary of the Test
fuller once again, looking for that swing but none at the moment, defended solidly
short of length this time, Zadran looks to go for the pull but is cramped. Ends up playing it in the air but luckily over square leg
length ball around off, steers it towards gully
short of length outside off, looks to punch off the back foot but mistimes it towards extra cover
short and wide outside off, opens the face of the bat to place it between cover and point, comes back for the second
length outside off, but well away from the batsman, shouldered arms
length but once again that sixth-stump line. Zadran is happy to let that go through
too full and too close this time, Zadran comes forward and drives it through the cover region, his second four
fuller and swinging in late this time, Zadran had planted his front foot down and across, gets an inside edge on to the pads
short of length at the batsman this time, defended from the back foot
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on from the front foot
fuller around fifth stump from wide of the crease. Ahmadi goes for the drive, gets a thick outside edge past the third slip
short of length outside off, pushes it towards point from the back foot
fuller outside off, coming in sharply with the angle, blocked from the front foot
short of length outside off, pushes it towards point from the back foot
length ball around off, looks to get behind it and defends
length ball around off and angled in, Ahmadi shouldered arms but it keeps coming in off the seam. Goes over the stumps
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it towards extra cover
a touch fuller around off, defended from the front foot
fuller around off, comes forward and offers another solid front-foot defence
short of length outside off, climbing towards the batsman who gets in an awkward position but does well to get his bottom hand off and play it down on the off side
another short one outside off, sways away from the line of the ball
fuller outside off and crunching drive towards cover. A tumbling stop there saves a boundary
length ball around off, gets behind it and blocks
length ball around off, some turn straightaway for the offspinner. Defended from the crease
tossed up around off, some spin once again. Ahmadi comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, defended from the front foot once again
tossed up around off, lunges forward and defends again
length ball spinning on the pads, shouts of 'catch it' as Ahmadi looks to defend. Just off the pad though
fuller and wider outside off, Zadran is not interested
fuller around off, comes forward and defends towards covers
length ball outside off, stays beside the line and defends on the off side
short of length outside off, some extra bounce there for Holder but it's too far away from the batsman, left alone
length ball around fifth stump, defends it towards cover from the back foot

length ball from wide of the crease, angling in towards Zadran who was looking to defend. Gets a thick outside edge past the cordon. A bit of teamwork from slip and gully fielder to stop it just inside
length ball around off, looks to defend but gets an inside edge on to the pad and past the keeper
length ball this time, defended on the leg side
tossed up around off and middle, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and blocks on the off side
fuller on the stumps, turns it towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps and spinning sharply down the leg side. Zadran pads it away carefully
fuller and in the corridor, some seam movement in to the batsman, left alone
length ball outside off, goes straight this time, left alone once again
length ball in the channel, once again a bit of seam movement in, left alone
a short one this time, Ahmadi looks to duck but it doesn't bounce as much, into the keeper's gloves off the shoulder
length ball around off, stays back and leg side of the ball, steers it towards the gully region
fuller and in the channel, shouldered arms
length ball around off and spinning big on to the pads. Zadran lets it hit the pads

fuller around off and Zadran goes for the sweep, looking to hit it behind square but misses. Holder at leg slip grabs it with an outstretched left hand while diving forward. An appeal for the catch and given. Zadran is not happy though but there is no DRS for this series. It's not clear from replays though if there was an edge
length ball around off and spinning big, past the batsman and the keeper for two byes
length ball on the stumps, defends it from the crease
length ball spinning on to the pads. Lobs past Holder at leg slip
changes his line to outside off, defended towards covers
length ball around off, a little bit of extra bounce. Looks to defend from the back foot. The ball hits high on the bat
length ball angling in but well outside off. Shouldered arms
fuller outside off, looks to defend but ends up playing down the wrong line. Almost squared up
length ball but on the pads, Ahmadi gets on his toes and flicks it away towards the vacant square leg region
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off and angling in. Ahmadi looks to push at it and gets beaten
length ball, turns in, and he goes back to defend
fuller, and he sweeps, and sweeps well! Gets to the pitch of it, and sweeps it towards long leg, and rolls his wrists along the way
presses forward to smother a length ball tossed up around off
sweep again, and to the same region. There's a good diving stop from Roston Chase, running around from deep square leg to cut it off. Again, picks this from around middle and sweeps it low and hard
sharp turn, and he goes back to defend this. Runs off his edge and goes low towards Hetmyer at short leg. Lands short of him, though
goes back to defend a length ball turning into him
length ball, around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, outside off, and he defends from the crease
shorter, just outside off, nipping further away, and he looks to guide it past the man at point. The fielder dives away to his left and stops it comfortably
fuller ball, straight, and he flicks this through the gap between mid-wicket and mid on and gets it to the fence for four. Good bit of timing from him
looks to go full, but goes a bit down the leg side, and he flicks it away towards long leg
shorter, and angles into him. He jumps to defend this towards mid-wicket
length, outside off, and he can poke this towards point. Only three fielders on the off side, and that's an easy single for him
length, angles in from outside off, and he goes back to defend
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
tossed up around off, and he presses forward to defend. Inside edge on to the pad, but doesn't pop up for short leg

tosses this up around off, and he presses forward. Beats the inside edge, and that has hit him on the inside of his right elbow. Needs some medical attention. Good bowling from Cornwall, who has got two balls to pitch at about the same spot, and just turn a bit differently
presses forward to defend a length ball around off, turning into him
full, but angles down the leg side, and he gets enough bat on it to run it down to fine leg. Not a bad idea as a ball, but the batsman gets the runs for it
fired flat, down the leg side, and well collected by the keeper
presses forward to smother one pitching around middle
fuller, and he steps out to drive this hard. Half-stopped by the bowler himself, as it runs away towards mid on
goes back to one pitched around middle and leg, and tries to flick it away towards fine leg
presses forward to defend a length ball around middle and leg
tosses this up around middle, and he whips it away towards midwicket
ooh, sharp turn! Bamboozles everybody as it turns it from around off and middle, and goes past the leg stump, strikes the batsman on the thigh pad, and beats the keeper to run down towards long stop
goes back to defend a length ball around middle
great ball again! Doesn't turn as much this time, and he plays for the turn and is beaten on the outside edge
defended from a length
length ball, around off, and he defends, pressing forward a touch
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length, tossed up around off, and he defends, pressing forward
fuller, and he defends after clearing his front leg
top shot! Flighted around off and middle, and he swats this hard and straight over the bowler's head. Just lands short of the long off boundary
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
presses forward, and straight, to meet a length ball and defend it
length, outside off, turns back in, and he defends with his bat close to his body
tossed up around off, spins quite a bit, but he presses forward to meet it with a dead bat
turns from around middle, and he flicks it away towards deep square leg. Rolls his wrists to keep it low and beyond short leg
length, and he presses forward to defend one turning in from outside off
presses forward to smother one tossed up around off
flighted, fuller, and he presses forward to defend
tossed up around off, and he stretches forward to drive. Gets it towards point
flighted around off, turning further away, and he looks to drive. It beats the outside edge
flighted around off, and he drives this hard, but cannot beat cover
defends a length ball around off
tossed up around off, and he has smacked this straight back over the bowler. One bounce and through to the long off fence
flighted around off again, and this time he drives along the ground, just to the left of silly mid-off
length, around off, and runs off the outside edge as he looks to defend. Stopped by the man at slip who chases it, just ahead of the third man boundary
length, and he plays for the turn, but it goes a bit straight on. Off the edge again, but this time doesn't go too far from slip
length, just outside off, and he plays a lofted sweep towards deep backward square leg. There's a man at the fence there, and it goes well short of him, but the pressure from Cornwall is telling
defends a length ball around off, turning back in
length, and he presses forward to defend
length, turns back in, and he plays back to it. Runs off the inner edge, and bounces close to off stump, before being collected by Dowrich!
length, outside off, and he drives this beautifully, along the ground, between cover and silly mid-off. Fielded by long-off
length, outside off, and he drives this towards cover point
defends a length ball around off
flighted around off, and he drives hard, but straight to cover
delivers from wider of the crease, slanting into Ahmadi, who presses forward to defend
wide of the crease again, offers a bit of width, and he goes back to cut, but cannot place it beyond point
length, turns across him, and he plays it with the spin, and places it just to the left of short leg
length, and he plays back and defends with the turn towards short leg
flights this, and puts it fuller towards the batsman, who defends from the crease

length, angles across him, and dropped by Dowrich! Difficult chance, as it just glanced his gloves as he looked to flick this. Hits the keeper on his pads, and then deflects along the ground towards slip
angles into him from around middle, and he plays back and defends
defends a length ball towards off stump with a forward press
flighted around leg, and he comes forward to drive this towards Holder at deep mid-on. They take on his arm and make it easily in the end
ooh, chancy! Flighted around off, and he looks to go towards long-off, but it runs off the outside edge, and just about clears the man at cover-point
length, and he goes back and looks to cut but is beaten by the lack of bounce in it. Past the inside edge
length, and he defends towards cover
fuller, and he gives it a solid thump towards mid-wicket
fuller, and he drives this towards cover
length, turns in, he looks to press forward, and it runs off the glove, but doesn't carry through to short leg
sharp turn from across him, pitching around off and middle, and he plays it with soft hands towards leg slip
MAXIMUM, and a crisp shot at that! Fuller, straighter, and he looks to go with the turn. Driven well, and past the log-on fence
tossed up around off, and he drives this straight and hard! Places it to the right of the man at cover, and that was then only headed ot the long-off fence
length, and he goes back and defends one turning into him with soft hands
length, and he presses forward to defend
tossed up around off, a bit slower through the air, and he checks his drive back towards the bowler, standing from the crease
length, angles away from him from around off, and he drives it towards short cover
defends a quicker, straighter ball towards short cover
fuller, and he drives this against the turn towards deep mid-on for a single
length, and defended towards cover

one shot too many! This is disappointing from Ahmadi, because he has looked good in this morning session. With lunch not long from now, this is irresponsible, especially with long-off in place. Tossed up by Warrican around off, and he looks to drive straight and hard. Wants to clear the man stationed at long-off, and possibly wanted to go wide of him too, but it's straight down his throat. West Indies will welcome this breakthrough, as the partnership was whirring along just perfectly for Afghanistan!
tossed up around off, and he drives back to the bowler
length, angles into him, and he drives this towards mid-on
tossed up around off, and he presses forward to smother it
defends a quicker one fired in through middle and off
tries to fetch a sweep from a ball outside off. Strikes him on the pad, and there's an appeal for leg-before, but that would probably have struck him outside the line
length, and driven towards mid-wicket
tossed up around off, and he whips it to the left of deep mid-on. Gets a single as the man there has to race around to his left before sending his throw back in
tossed up around middle and off, and he drives with the turn towards cover-point
tossed up around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, and he defends from the crease
length, and he goes back to cut. Gets it straight to point
fuller, and he dabs this down to fine leg. Terrific shot in the end, as he gets outside the line and then gets just enough bat to run it down to the fence
length, and he goes back to whip it away with the turn. Cannot beat short leg
length, and he presses forward to defend. Good ball, as he holds the length back a touch. Goes off the pad and pops up just short of short leg
length, outside off, and he plays it late and with soft hands towards first slip

gets his man! This time there's no evading first slip. Terrific bowling from Cornwall. Tosses this up, around off, and it doesn't turn as much as Ihsanullah expects. He presses forward to defend, and it runs off the outside edge, quick and straight to Shai Hope. That's lunch too, and those two wickets will make that lunch taste all that better for the West Indies
fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards midwicket and gets off the mark
tossed up at the batsman who skips down and smothers it
length ball around off, stays in his crease and defends on the off side
a touch fuller around off, drives it towards cover-point without much footwork
fuller around off, once again not much feet movement but gets behind this and blocks
fuller around fifth stump, moves forward this time and drives it towards extra cover
fuller and closer this time, Asghar gets behind it and blocks
length ball around off, comes forward and defends. The ball lands on his front foot and rolls towards the bowler

Cornwall and Holder combine again! Tossed up around off and middle, Rahmat moves across and looks to defend but the ball spins sharply to take the inside edge. A relatively easier catch for Holder this time, low but he didn't have to dive
length ball around off, turn and bounce for Cornwall to cramp the batsman, who defends it on the back foot
sharp turn once again, Jamal defends it from the back foot, with soft hands, the ball bounces over the stumps
a touch fuller this time, comes forward and blocks
short of length outside off, goes back to cut but is cramped by the turn, dabs it towards slip
length ball around off and middle, turns it on the leg side from the back foot
short of length down the leg side, pulls it towards fine leg
short of length around off, Jamal was looking to come forward, defends it towards gully in the end
fuller on the stumps, flicked but straight towards square leg. Still to open his account in Test cricket
fuller and in the corridor, left alone by Jamal
length ball, around sixth-stump, comes forward and shoulders arms
length ball around off stump, looks to defend, more like pushing at it and gets beaten
fuller around off, flicks it away towards midwicket for an easy single
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks

length ball around off and middle, was looking to play it on the leg side but ends up closing the face too early. The ball doesn't turn as much either. A thick outside edge past first slip to take Jamal off the mark in Test cricket
length ball around middle and leg, turns it behind square leg
fuller on the stumps, lunges forward and blocks
fuller around off, Jamal was once again looking to work on the leg side, the outside edge goes straight to Hope at first slip this time. Cornwall has his fourth, Afghanistan tottering at 95 for 5
short of length outside off, stays back and defends it towards cover-point
short and pulled away towards deep-backward square leg, the call is for two but Roach is quick to get to it from fine leg
length ball in the corridor, left alone by Zazai
length ball around off, stays back and defends it in front of square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off
length ball outside off, comes forward and looks to defend with hard hands. A thick outside edge dribbles towards gully
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, flicked away uppishly between the short leg fielder's leg, backward square leg cuts it off
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and digs it out towards midwicket. Not a very confident looking shot though
length ball around off, keeps straight after pitching. A very watchful Asghar defends it from the back foot
length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it towards square leg

maiden five-for in Test cricket for Cornwall. Not the best of the deliveries tough, it was short and wide, Asghar went back to cut but it went straight and the extra bounce meant he could get only an edge to it. Dowrich made no mistake
short of length outside off, rises with the bounce and defends it towards cover-point
fuller outside off, comes forward and leans into the defence. Gets a thick outside edge but it falls well short of Cornwall at first slip. 100 is up for Afghanistan as it runs away for four

dropped by Cornwall at first slip! Was low to his left but definitely catch-able. Was fuller outside off, Zazai once again looked to defend with hard hands but Cornwall couldn't get down quickly enough as the ball went past his left hand
length ball in the corridor, left alone
goes past the outside edge. Was again a length ball but well away from the batsman. Zazai though looked to push at it and got beaten
fuller on the stumps, presents the full face of the bat but cannot beat mid-on
tossed up around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and turns it towards slip
flatter and quicker outside off, opens the face to work it towards point
fuller on the stumps, goes for the reverse sweep, but fails to make any contact. Dowrich was blinded by the batsman but still should have stopped it. Didn't move quickly enough
length ball on the stumps, stays back and defends
flatter on the stumps, blocked from the crease
short of length at the batsman, Afsar hops in his crease, gets on the top of it and defends it down
length ball around off and middle, flicks it towards short midwicket
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-on
fuller again and another good-looking on-drive, once again straight towards mid-on though
short and wide outside off, goes for the cut but misses
a touch fuller and in the corridor, left alone by Zazai

length ball spinning down the leg side. Rashid goes for the flick and Holder can just get his fingertips to it. By the reaction of the fielders, it looks like there was some bat involved. So that would go down as a drop
fuller around off, defended with a big stride forward
length ball around off, sweeps it towards deep-backward square leg
jumps out of his crease but cannot get to the pitch of the ball, flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball around off, spinning in sharply to cramp and thwart the attempted cut
length ball around off and middle, defended from the back foot
short of length outside off, stays back and defends on the off side
fuller and wider outside off, Rashid chases it, looking to smash it square of the wicket, gets beaten
fuller ball on the stumps, turns it towards square leg
pitched up outside off, comes forward and drives it towards cover
short of length outside off, looks to push at on the off side but it bounces more than Rashid expected. Gets beaten. An appeal for caught-behind but no bat there

Cornwall makes no mistake this time! Was a touch fuller around fifth stump, Rashid looked to defend only to get an outside edge low to first slip. Cornwall did better this time, got his finger underneath the ball and took it neatly
length ball at the stumps, goes back and pushes it towards short midwicket
fuller around off, Hamza is watchful and opens the face of the bat to run it past first slip. Off the mark in Test cricket with a boundary
and again. Pitched up outside off and Hamza once again steers it behind the stumps, much squarer this time but the result is same
fuller outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards cover
length ball around off, stays back and defends square of the wicket
skips down the track, reaches to the pitch of the ball and whips it past short midwicket. Third boundary from the over
fuller around off, comes forward and defends with his bat in front of his pad
fuller again, just around the off stump. Comes forward and defends
length ball outside off, comes forward and opens the face to steer it towards point
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length ball around off, stays in the crease and defends it towards cover
short of length at the batsman, who gets on his toes and defends
length ball around middle and leg, turns it towards leg slip
length ball around off, lunges forward and works it towards midwicket
fuller on the stumps, defends inside out towards cover
length ball outside off, goes for the sweep but misses. A big appeal for lbw but Paul Reiffel says not out
fuller outside off, Hamza was stuck on the back foot, pushes at it and gets a thick outside edge past first slip
length, a little wide of off, and he drives towards cover
length, and it angles into him. He looks to flick, and keeps it down on its way through to mid-wicket
full, and he whips it as it angles down the leg side towards long leg
full ball, towards middle and leg, and he defends from the crease
defends a length ball around off

full, a bit wide of off, and that allows him to ease into a square drive. Gets it past point, and has enough legs to run away to the backward point fence. Need some more of that to get to a competitive enough score
length, and he hangs back and plays it with the turn towards mid-wicket
hangs the length back a bit, straighter, and he presses forward to defend
defends, stretching forward to meet a length ball around middle
length, and he plays it with the turn towards square leg. Goes all the way back in his crease, and plays it late, with the turn
length, and he goes back to defend
length, turns in a bit, and he plays from the crease, tapping it away towards point
length, just outside off, and he drives this towards deep point. Refuses a single
full ball, and he drives hard, but cannot beat mid-on
length, outside off, and he drives this wider of cover. A half-stop, but he cannot prevent the single from ticking over
shorter in length, outside off, and Hamza ducks under it. Didn't lift as much as one might have expected. Is that a sign of variable bounce on this pitch?
short again, angles into him, and he jumps inside his crease to defend this. Off the inside edge
short, but angles down the leg side, and he defends towards square leg
length, goes on with the arm, and he goes back and dabs this beyond second slip
tosses this up around off, a bit of drift away, before it turns back in. He stretches forward to defend
length, angles across him, and he goes back to defend
tossed up, around off and middle, and he stretches to defend
length, sharp turn back in, and he plays from the crease. Pops up off his pad and lands short of short leg
big turn back in from outside off again, and he hangs back to push it towards point
length, and he presses forward to defend
length, angles into him before straightening, and he goes back to defend
fuller ball, and he drives against the turn, but with a good forward press, down to long-on
length, and he presses forward to defend
stretches forward to defend a length ball. Opens the face of the bat to keep it wide of silly point, and is able to pick up runs towards point
presses forward to defend a length ball
fuller, and he drives it with the turn towards deep mid-wicket
fuller, and he drives it back towards the bowler
tossed up, and he drives this towards cover
fuller, and he defends this back down the pitch
length, and he looks to defend. Gets into an awkward position as the ball turns across him from leg stump, but he defends well
flighted, wide, and he eases into a square drive. Not enough protection on the off side, and that's an easy boundary picked up. Valuable runs!
length, fired in towards the leg stump, and he goes back to defend
defends a length ball around off and middle
runs this off the outside edge to one that was fuller, and on off stump. Evades slip and runs away towards third man
fired in towards the pads, and he can go back and whip this away towards deep backward square
tossed up, and he drives this wide of cover. A diving stop by the man stationed there
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length, and he tries to advance down the wicket. Ends up yorking himself, and drives it back down the wicket
presses forward to nudge a length ball towards point
length, played with the turn towards square leg
defends a length ball towards point
length ball, around off, and he defends
length, and he presses forward to defend. Hits the bat quite high up, but there's no silly point in place. Harmlessly goes towards cover
length, and he presses forward to defend this right by his feet
length, and he presses forward to defend
length, tossed up around middle and off, and he drives past the bowler down to long-off
fuller ball, around off, and he defends, pressing forward
tossed up, and he takes the invitation to drive. A bit uppish, but squeezed between second slip and silly point
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length, and he goes back and defends this towards square leg
tossed up around off, and he defends from the crease
length, and he goes back and defends
length, and he stretches to defend
length, and he stretches to defend
hangs back to defend a length ball turning into him from outside off
angles this in towards leg, and he defends off the crease
presses forward to defend a ball around off
length, and he stretches forward to defend
length ball, around the stumps, and he stretches forward to defend
flighted around leg stump, and he drives it back towards the bowler
fired in flatter, straighter, and he flicks it towards mid-wicket
length, turns in from outside off, but it is slow turn. The batsman can go back and defend. Bounces close to the stumps, though!
fuller, and he looks to drive. It beats him, and the keeper, and runs away towards fine leg off Dowrich's left leg
is that a drop? Length ball that turned across him, and he went back to defend, and the turn took it low to the right toe of short leg, and he just failed to grab that half-chance
length, and he presses forward to defend
defends a fuller ball around middle and leg
length, and he presses forward to defend. Driven towards cover
length, up around off, and he defends, pressing forward
flatter, but down the leg side, and he can hang back and whip this towards deep square leg
length, straightens after pitching around leg, and he defends from the crease
length, and he hangs back to tap this towards cover
defends a length ball towards cover

indiscreet, but gets away with it! Dragged a touch short by Warrican and his eyes light up as he goes back to smash this over mid-wicket. Takes the top edge and goes straight back, and just far enough to not get deep mid-on involved with a catch!
tossed up around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, and he stretches forward to defend
length, and he hangs back and plays it with the turn towards square leg
fuller length, angles across him, and beats the outside edge! Slightly lazy from Hamza, as he looks to just hang his bat out and defend
length, wide outside off, and he sweeps from there. Does well to keep it down and play it towards deep square-leg
length, turns back in from outside off, and he defends
good ball! Angles in from wide of the crease, and turns just enough to beat the bat. Hamza was playing for the angle coming in
top shot! Goes down on his haunches and sweeps this firm, and fine. A stylish way to bring up the 50 of the partnership as well! Invaluable
full, and he defends this from the crease
fuller, and he makes a bit of room to the onside to drive this away towards point
length, and he goes back and watchfully defends this right under his nose
length, and he defends again
length, and he goes back and drives this towards mid-wicket
presses forward to defend a length ball. Goes with the turn, and takes the inner edge towards square leg
length, outside off, and he runs it with the outer part of the bat towards point
presses forward to defend, and the turn takes the inside edge, and just past short leg. Streaky single
length, turns across him, and he looks to flick this. Just short of Holder at leg slip!

Cornwall has six! Plays back to one that was tossed a long way up. Pitched around off, and didn't turn as much as Zazai expected, and it has hit him in front, as he was looking to shuffle across. Perhaps would have been good enough to just take the top of leg-stump, but this is an important breakthrough for West Indies at tea!
short, and he hops to defend this off the crease
length, and he presses forward to drive. Cannot beat cover
fuller, and he drives this towards mid-on
length, and he presses forward to defend
dug in short, and he ducks under this
short, and he ducks under this too
fuller around off, defended from the crease
fuller at the stumps, jams his bat at it
fuller around off, turns it towards leg slip
length ball on middle and leg, pads it away
length ball on the stumps, defended on the leg side
down the track and takes on the long-on, clears him with ease
fuller, in the channel, left alone
short of length outside off, steers it behind point
length ball in the corridor, shouldered arms
short of length outside off, looks to push at it, gets beaten by the extra bounce
a full toss on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg
length ball but down the leg side and glanced away towards the fine leg boundary
swept away towards deep midwicket, Chase does the tidying up
fuller around leg, plays inside out, gently towards the mid-off
sweeps again, this time behind square leg. Only a single
tossed up on a length around off, looks to flick but misses due to extra bounce
length ball around off, defended back towards the bowler
fuller on middle and leg, turned away in front of square leg
length ball around off, defended towards cover from the crease
length ball in the corridor, left alone
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off
short of length angling towards the rib cage, defends it on the leg side
fuller around fifth stump, Hamza looks to drive it on the up and gets beaten
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
tossed up on the stumps, defends it gently on the leg side
down the track, reaches to the pitch of the ball and whips it over the bowler's head. Cornwall isn't happy
length ball around off, stays back and pushes it just past short leg
length ball around off, stays back and defends it on the off side
fuller down the leg side and swiped away towards the deep-backward square leg boundary
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and defends it back towards Cornwall
short of length around off, rises with the ball and defends it towards the cover
length ball around off, stays back and defends

and Holder has his second. An outside edge to the keeper, a regulation catch for Dowrich. This was too good for Hamza, coming in with the angle, forcing the batsman to play and then moving away late to take the edge
fuller at the stumps, Zahir gets his bat down to keep it away
fuller but angling down the leg side, misses and is hit on the pads but was going down
length ball, around fifth stump, Zahir stays away from it
fuller on the stumps, turns it towards the leg side
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards square leg
down the track, to the pitch but doesn't get the required elevation despite the neat connection. Warrican takes a good catch to his left at long-off
full, angles into him, and he flicks this away. There's a fine leg, but he has let this slip through, and that's four!
length, a hint of outswing, and Brathwaite lets it pass outside the off stump
leg-cutter again, pitching around off stump and moving further away. Watchfully lets this one pass through
angles away from outside off, and he leaves this as well

hits him on the pad, and that is a good ball! Loud appeal, but turned down, as Brathwaite fails to get this away! Close, as the replays suggest this may have just snuck down the leg side, and also hit him quite high up
swings away, and he leaves
a huge appeal straightaway. Length ball outside off and spinning in sharply. Betas the forward defence to hit the pads, but there was an inside edge
goes back and works it behind square leg with the turn
length ball around off, Brathwaite looks to defend but is beaten by the turn
and again! Length ball outside off, lunges forward to block, misses again
length ball around off, pushed towards covers from the back foot
flatter on the pads, stays back and flicks it towards deep backward square leg
length ball in the channel, left alone
fuller around fifth stump, Campbell comes forward before leaving it alone
length ball in the channel, shouldered arms once again
fuller outside off again, almost an action replay. Same response by the batsman - leaves it alone
fuller, a bit of tail in to the left-hander who comes forward and blocks
pitched up once again, flicked but cannot get past the square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and defends on the off side
length ball outside off, Brathwaite comes forward but keeps his bat inside the line
length ball wide of the crease, angling towards the off stump and spinning away. Beats the bat
length ball on the stumps, defended from the back foot
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers
short of length at the stumps, goes back and punches it towards mid-on
fuller on the pads and flicked away towards fine leg
length ball in the channel, left alone
fuller, around sixth stump, stays low and bounces well in front of the keeper
fuller on the stumps, stays back and defends
fuller around off, stays back and blocks
fuller around off, comes forward and flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball around off, moves across and turns it towards short fine leg
length ball outside off, goes back and across and defends with a straight bat
fuller outside off, goes low and outside off to scoop it past short fine leg
reverse sweep this time, gets a top edge that goes over first slip and dribbles towards the boundary
length ball around off, goes back and outside off to block it
length ball around middle, defended in front of the pads
fuller outside off, Brathwaite is stuck on the back foot, gets a thick outside edge that goes into the ground and runs past the diving second slip
fuller on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
fuller around off, Brathwaite is once again on the back foot, defends it towards cover
fuller on the stumps, Brathwaite gets low and defends it back towards the bowler
pitched up outside off, defends it towards cover from the front foot
beats the bat. Length ball outside off and keeps going away to beat the outside edge as Campbell looks to defend
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
googly, short of length around off, Campbell defends it from the back foot
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks under his eyes
goes for the slog sweep, makes a brilliant connection and sends it over deep midwicket boundary
length ball around off, punched towards short midwicket from the back foot
length, turns across Brathwaite, and runs off the outside edge, and goes towards second slip, but just short
tossed up, flighted around off, and called a no-ball as he oversteps
skips down the wicket and whips a length ball towards mid-on. Takes on the fielder, and there's a direct hit too! He's made his ground at the non-striker's end, though
plonks his front foot down and whips this with the turn towards long-on. Good bit of fielding by Rashid Khan there
defends a length ball around off

there's the breakthrough! Bowls this wide of the crease, and pushes it through a bit flatter and straighter. Brathwaite stretches forward to defend, but plays outside the line of this. A maiden wicket for Hamza after Nitin Menon takes a long, hard look. He's convinced that this would have gone on with the angle and clipped the top of leg, I would think
wide of the crease, some sharp turn, and it goes off the outside edge, and beats second slip. They run three as the ball runs away towards the third man boundary, and is just pulled back in time
length, and he goes back and whips this with his wrists towards mid-wicket
straighter, and he goes back and defends this as it pitches and straightens from middle
tossed up, sharp turn away, and Hope chases it a bit with his front foot. Lets it pass in the end
beaten outside off! Flighted around off, and turns just a touch. Hope presses forward to defend, and it zips past the outside edge. Neat take by Zazai. An appeal as an afterthought
quicker one, outside off, and he presses forward to defend
wrong 'un, angles into him, and he plays it off his hips towards deep mid-wicket. They run hard and convert this into three
wide of the crease, a bit wide of off, and he goes back to drive this towards extra cover
presses forward to meet a ball fired from wide of the crease. Straighter, and the bowler appeals, but that goes off the inside edge, on to pad, and then falls well ahead of short leg
tossed up around off, and he plays a check-drive towards deep mid-off
tossed up, and he drives this. Cover gets his fingers to it, tipping it away to the right of mid-off
length, and he stretches forward to flick this towards mid-wicket
skips down the wicket again, and this has been fired quicker, into the pads. Off his pads as he scrambles to get his body behind the line of it, and pops back up towards the bowler

what a ball this is from Rashid Khan! That's a leg-spinner's dream ball...pitches on middle, straightens, and goes at a good enough pace, pitched on a good enough length, to find Hope inside the crease. Kisses the outside edge and flies low to first slip. Rashid Khan lets out a celebratory jump. He knows he has removed one of the main batsmen that could have taken the attack to the Afghan spinners in the West Indies camp. An absolute ripper!
wrong 'un, starts from around off, and he goes back and guides this down to fine leg with a neat flick of the wrists
tossed up around middle, and forces Brooks to come forward and defend
shorter in length, turns away, and he hangs back and swats this wide of point. Easy single
length, turns back sharply over the wicket into Campbell. He takes his bottom hand off and rides the storm

this is close! Length ball, straightens into Campbell as he plays back. Hits him fairly high on the pads as he misses an attempted flick. Loud appeal from Rashid and the other fielders, but turned down
wide of the crease, angles down the leg side, and he can flick this away towards long leg. Square leg gives it a game chase, but cannot get across to it
wide of the crease, straightens into him from middle and leg, and he presses forward to defend

appeal for a caught-behind, but not given! In fact, Afghanistan were celebrating all the way through, but there looks to have been no outside edge. It's a top ball. Just around off, and he presses forward to defend, and it just misses his bat as he stretches to defend. Probably bat on pad or ground
goes back and tries to play a length ball away towards leg. Strikes him on the pad but going down leg
length, runs off the outside edge, and goes just short of second slip
plays back to a length ball, and is able to maneouvre it towards square leg with the incoming angle of it
fuller, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, just outside off, and he presses forward to drive. Fielded by Rashid
shorter, and he goes back and drives this back towards deep mid-off
length, and he goes back to defend this. Pitched outside off, and turning away a touch
length, and he flicks this towards mid-wicket
tossed up, turns back in, and he goes back and defends from the crease
length, turns back in, and Campbell plays back to this. Just able to keep it out
skips down the wicket, and turns this into a half-volley. Driven back towards the bowler, who gets his left hand to it, and it just evades the stumps, before rolling away to the right of mid-on
length, straightens, and he defends with a slight forward press
length, straightens and he defends
tossed up, and he drives this back towards the bowler
length, and he presses forward in a bid to cover the spin, and also eliminate lbw as an option. Defends with his bat, stretching forward
straight, quick ball, angles across Campbell at good pace, and he leaves
beats the outside edge this time! Another wrong 'un, and he stretches forward to meet it, but is beaten
length, and he presses forward and meets it almost as a half-volley. Driven with soft hands towards mid-off and they take a quick single
straightens after pitching on middle and leg, and he looks to flick this. Uppish, but short of mid-on
goes back to drive a shorter one towards wide cover
fuller, down the leg side, and gets away with it. Brooks wants to sweep this fine, but cannot lay bat on it
tosses this up around off, and he drives this towards cover
length, and he plays it with the turn towards mid-wicket
fuller, and straighter, and he swings this down towards long-on. Rashid Khan has to roll to stop that, and that gives them a split second extra to come back for a second run
length, and he plays back and turns it with the spin towards square leg
wide of the crease, fired towards leg stump, and strikes Brooks on the pads as he looks ot defend. Appeal for leg before, but comfortably missing leg
turns away from a length, and Brooks lets this pass just outside off
flatter, towards leg stump, and Campbell goes back and flicks this towards square leg
flatter again, towards leg stump, and he flicks it away towards mid-wicket
drags this shorter, and Campbell can hang back and pull this towards deep square leg
wrong 'un, turns in from outside off, and he defends from the crease, moving across to cover the turn
length, pitching around middle and going on with the angle. Hope hangs back and defends
fuller, and he plays a delightful drive with the turn. Beats cover, beats mid-off, and I dare say leaves them both as silent, admiring spectators. Top-quality!
tossed up around off, and he drives with the turn away towards cover
presses forward to smother a ball floated around leg and middle
short, bad ball, and he goes back and cuts it away. Yamin Ahmadzai makes a half-stop at point, and has conceded four in the process of pulling it back from the backward point fence
fuller, just around off stump, and he defends pressing forward
wrong 'un, fired in short, and Campbell has picked this early! Rocks back and smashes this away through the vacant mid-wicket region
googly, from well outside off, and Campbell could leave this alone knowing the length and line meant it wouldn't be posing a challenge to his stumps
length, and he goes back and punches this towards mid-off

length, just outside off, and he runs this down with the outer part of the bat towards third man. Deliberate, as he adjusts late to the line of this, turning away from him, and uses the pace to run it down

another time Afghanistan start celebrating prematurely! Length ball, turns away, with good bounce, and Brooks comes forward, and is beaten outside off. Probably a slight noise of bat brushing pad as he stretches, but not close enough anyway. Nitin Menon seems to suggest to keeper Zazai to be a bit more judicious with his appealing
length, and he defends as it straightens
length, straightens from leg and middle, and he presses forward to defend
length, wrong 'un, and it runs off the inner part of the bat towards short leg. Short of the man there, though
strives for a fuller ball, but ends up overcooking it. Driven through point
short, and he can go back and ease this through the cover region
length, moves away from outside off, and he leaves
wide, outside off, and he looks to go back and cut this. Extra bounce takes it past the blade
sharp turn, away from outside off, and Campbell reads it well off the hand. Covers the line of the stumps, and leaves

floated wider again, looking for the googly, but Campbell pushes forward and leaves. There's some good turn back in, but it starts from around the fifth or sixth stump, and never came back enough to threaten the batsman
length, and he goes back and defends as it straightens after pitching around leg
length, just outside off, and he leaves. Straightens after angling in, so a safe leave
length, straight, fast, and makes Brooks play. He plays it off the crease, defending comfortably
a little shorter, and he goes back and defends this from the crease
length, and he goes back to defend
length, and he hangs back and drives this towards cover. No runs, though
goes for the reverse sweep and puts it behind point for four
fuller outside off, another reverse sweep and another four for Campbell
goes for the conventional sweep this time, finds deep square leg but a misfield allows an extra run
turns to the leg side
swept from outside off, this time in front of square leg, the man at deep square leg had no chance
slog-swept again, was in the air. Shouts of catch it but bounces well in front of the deep square leg
a lap sweep towards fine leg
length ball, stays back, punches is towards mid-on
fuller outside off, drives it through extra cover, beating the fielder at mid-off
sweeps it towards deep square leg to bring up his half-century
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, lunges forward and blocks
length ball around off, defended from the crease
length ball around off, punched towards short midwicket from the back foot
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
a googly, looks to drive but finds the inner half and the ball dribbles back towards the bowler
length ball down the leg side, misses the flick
tossed up around off, skips down and looks to drive along the ground, an inside edge on to the pads
length ball around off, stays back and blocks
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards mid-on
length ball around off, punched back
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it towards covers
length ball on the pads, goes for the flick but misses, gets a leg-bye
short and down the leg side, goes for the sweep but instead gets it fine. That works as it races away towards the fine leg boundary
fuller around off, takes it on and smashes it over long-on, cracking sound from the bat
length ball on the pads, connects the sweep well and plays it fine, four more to fine leg
length ball around off, punches it towards mid-off
fuller outside off, sweeps it towards deep midwicket, another powerful sweep

what a brilliant catch. Great anticipation too, from Ihsanullah who moved from first slip to his right after seeing the batsman shaping up for a lap sweep. Campbell failed to middle it and it lobbed towards leg gully. Ihsanullah put in the dive and took with his right hand
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards the bowler
length again, punches it towards short midwicket
short of length outside off, a googly. Goes for the cut but gets beaten
length ball on the stumps, stays back and blocks
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but misses. A loud appeal for caught-behind but the umpire says not out. No DRS available for this game
length ball around off, pushes it towards covers
fuller on the stumps, flicks it behind square leg
fuller on the stumps, pushes at it and gets an inside edge behind square leg
fuller around off, pushes it back
length ball around off, comes forward to defend, gets a thick outside edge past first slip, short third man puts in the change
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts, the ball dribbles towards short extra cover
fuller around middle and leg, defended from the front foot
length ball at the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the stumps, flicks but short leg comes in the way
length ball on the pads, flicks it away towards backward square leg
short of length outside off, gets back and cuts it towards backward point
fuller on the pads, looks to turn on the leg side, bat-pad and lobs towards backward square leg
fuller on the pads, flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball on the pads, looks to flick but misses. An appeal for lbw but denied. Was going down I think
angling on the pads, glanced towards fine leg for a couple
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and smothers
a touch fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg, the fielder in the circle puts in the chase and keeps it to three. Brooks moves to 49
slower and shorter, pulls it towards square leg
a googly from outside off, a length ball. Goes back and blocks
fuller outside off, comes forward to defend but ends up playing inside the line and misses
fuller on the pads, looks to flick but gets a thick outside edge towards extra cover
length ball in the channel, leaves alone. Was a googly, Rashid has his hands on head but good leave in the end
short of length at the stumps, defended towards short leg from the back foot
too full outside off, digs it back towards the bowler. A maiden over for Rashid, Brooks still on 49
short of length outside off, cuts it towards point
fuller at the stumps, comes forward and blocks
fuller and a touch wider, latches on to it and drives it powerfully past extra cover
looks to repeat the shot but gets an inside edge past the stumps this time, a desperate dive by Javed Ahmadi from deep square leg towards his left
length ball outside off, opens the face to work it towards first slip
length ball at the stumps, comes forward to defend
a googly from outside leg to beat the bat, hits the back thigh and lobbed towards first slip
fuller on the stumps, defends it towards short leg
fuller around off, goes down the wicket and looks to hit towards long-on, doesn't middle it and the ball goes towards deep midwicket

Paul Reiffel takes a while before raising his finger. Was a length ball pitching around middle, Hetmyer came forward to defend but missed and the ball hit the front pad. A big appeal and given out. Replays show it might have just missed or just clipped the leg stump, a close call
length, defends from the crease
flicks away towards fine leg
eases a length ball towards point, and that's fifty for Brooks!
fuller ball, and he drives it back towards the bowler
flatter, towards the pads, and Chase can back away and whip this away towards deep square leg
flatter, outside off, and he goes back to defend. Spins back in sharply, and he is able to defend it
length, a bit wide of off, an dhe taps it to point
turns across him from a good length. Top ball! Chase does well to...well, not chase it
length, and he goes back to defend one that turns slightly away from off
tossed up a bit, and it turns past his outside edge! Brooks, you have to say, plays it well, by keeping bat close to body
short, and dispatched! Picks the length early, and hangs back, transfers his body weight perfectly on to the back foot before driving this through point
fuller ball, outside off, turns away and catches the outer part of the bat. He looks to drive, and this runs away towards point
short again, turns back into him, and he flicks it towards deep square leg
fuller, and he presses forward to defend

presses forward, and inside-edges this into the lap of short leg! Great ball from Zahir, as he gets it to dip a touch and deceives Chase in flight, as he presses forward to defend. Off the inside edge, and goes low to Ibrahim Zadran, who stays low and catches it smartly
flighted, way outside off, and he looks to drive. It travels quickly along the ground to Ibrahim Zadran, who under-arms this on to the stumps, but he's inside the crease
length, turns back in, and he defends from the crease
short, and he goes back and flogs this away towards long leg. Wanted to get the ball to turn back in sharply, but started too short, and Dowrich doesn't miss out
length, and he defends from the crease
length, spins off the outside edge, perhaps beaten by the straighter angle, but played with soft hands. Runs towards third man, past slip
length, spins away after pitching around off, beats the outside edge as the batsman plays back
big stride forward, and smothers a leg-break, fizzing away from just around off stump
length, and he plays back to this, defending it watchfully
googly, floated ouside off, and he leaves
short, and he goes back and pulls this away. Tries the googly, but bowls a much shorter length than he needs to, and Dowrich takes full toll
length, and he defends as it spins away from middle
length, and he goes back and whips this towards square leg
fuller, and he drives this hard back down the pitch. Started around off
wrong line, as it starts around leg and turns further down the leg side. Left alone
short again, and turns away from him, and he is able to play it towards mid-wicket
tosses this up outside off, inviting the drive, and Dowrich is happy to oblige! Ends up being a full toss, and he can get this away through the cover region
short of a good length, and he goes back to defend this
brisk, leg-break just outside off, and he goes back to defend from the crease
length, and he defends from the crease
length, starts around middle and leg, and he plays it watchfully from within the crease

DROPPED! Sharp legbreak, and he comes forward to defend this. Looks like it kisses the glove and then bounces further away, hits Zazai on the right shoulder and pops up, but falls a little further to the right than the keeper would have wanted
defends a length ball around off
length, and he hangs back and pushes this towards cover
length, outside off, and he presses forward to block this
fuller ball, just outside off, turning back in, and he presses forward to drive it back down the pitch

Afghanistan believe they've got him, but it's not given! Length ball, turns back in, and he stretches forward to defend. The ball pitches around off and comes back in, and strikes him on the pad. The stride was a long one, though
presses forward to a length ball and defends
sharp, quick turn from outside off, back in to the right-hander, who goes back to play. Off the inside edge and through towards fine leg
length, and he pushes this to the right of mid-off. They set off immediately and complete the single comfortably
length, and he presses forward to defend
length, starts around middle and leg, turning back away from him, and he presses forward to defend
tries to bowl a quicker one across him, and he reads it perfectly. Hangs back and flicks it through towards fine leg
short again, and he goes back and smacks this hard. Cannot beat Amir Hamza at mid-wicket, though
length, turns back into him from outside off, and he defends this watchfully
slower, tossed up a touch outside off, and he defends from the crease
fuller, around off, turning back in, and he drives this back down the wicket with a forward press
floated outside off, and he drives this wide of cover
full toss, around off, and he drives this to cover
fuller, around middle, and he flicks this towards mid-wicket
fuller length, around leg, turns across him, and he defends this with a straight bat
a bit shorter, and he goes back to punch this towards cover. Nasir Jamal quickly moves across to his left and rifles in a throw
bowled from wide of the crease, good length, and he presses forward to defend

probably going down leg! Hamza goes wide of the crease again, and fires this at the middle and leg line. Dowrich plays back again and it strikes him on the pad. Loud appeal, but correct decision in the end
length, and he defends from the crease
presses forward to defend a length ball around middle and leg
length, and he presses forward to meet it with a dead bat
slightly shorter, and can go back and push this wide of cover
short, and towards the leg stump, and he can whip this off his legs towards deep square leg
fired in towards the pads, and turns further away. He looks to flick this away and gets it off the pads towards fine leg
length, outside off, and he presses forward before driving to mid-off
length, turns back in from middle and off, and he goes back and flicks this between leg slip and short leg. Easy two towards long leg
fuller ball, and he flicks this towards deep mid-wicket
a little shorter, turns away after pitching on leg, and further down leg. He leaves
length, and he plays it with soft hands to smother the spin across him
plays back to a length ball and defends it after it turns away from leg towards off
fuller ball, and he meets it with a stride forward towards cover
fuller, wider, and he drives this towards cover, getting a good stride forward
wide of the crease, length ball, and he defends with a half-press forward
presses forward to smother the spin on one pitching around off
length, spins away from leg and middle, and defended on the off-side
googly, starts from outside off, but Brooks reads it well and leaves
length, outside off, and he defends
tries to bowl this quicker, but ends up bowling a full toss on leg stump. It's low, though, and Brooks can only whip this away towards deep square leg
length, and he looks to flick this. It runs off the outer edge, but along the ground, to the right of point
goes back to defend a length ball pitching around off
short, and he goes back to pull this. Gets it off the inner part of the bat as it takes a deflection off short leg's foot and goes towards square leg
length, and he presses forward to defend
short, and he goes back to punch this towards cover
length, and he presses forward to defend this
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
loud appeal for leg before, but he has got a good stride in! Strikes him on the pad as it turns away from middle and runs away past slip towards third man. Probably would have missed off stump too
length, and he stays back in the crease to punch this towards cover
presses forward to meet a length ball around off stump
stretches forward to a length ball around off, and gets an inside-edge, past short leg and towards short fine-leg
length, around middle, and he drives it back towards the bowler after getting a big stride in
fuller, and he has drilled this straight back past the bowler! Gets a good stride in and drives it past Rashid, and also gives no chance to Asghar Afghan at mid-on. Raced away!
length ball, and he plays it from the crease towards mid-on
length, and he goes back to defend
length, and he defends from the crease
turns across him, and he plays it with a defensive prod towards the off side
plays back to one pitching around off, and defends it watchfully
length, and he goes back to defend
slightly shorter, and outside off, and he goes back to defend
length, a bit of swing into him, and he jags his bat down in time to play it away towards fine leg. Runs away for four, but that was off the inside edge
fuller again, angling in towards middle and he defends from the crease
length, turns back in towards him, and Brooks leaves. Wasn't too far off the top of off! Brave, but good leave in the end
length, and he goes back to defend this from the crease
length, outside off, and doesn't come back in this time. Brooks reads it perfectly, and leaves
looks for a fuller ball, but goes down the leg side again. Glances this away towards fine leg, and just uses the pace of the ball to get it down to fine leg for four
and he starts with a full toss, flicked towards short midwicket
flatter and quicker at the stumps, defended from the back foot
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
a googly, from outside off, Dowrich comes forward to defend but is beaten. A loud appeal for lbw but perhaps the impact was just outside the line of off stump
fuller around off, drives it back towards the bowler
short of length on middle and leg, goes back and pulls it past short midwicket
fuller and wider outside off, goes for the drive and misses
fuller around off, comes forward and offers a solid defence
fuller, around fifth stump, shouldered arms by Brooks
length ball around off, comes forward and defends it under his eyes
fuller around off, comes forward and drives back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, left alone
fuller around off, a googly again. Looks to flick away but misses. Maybe an inside edge on to the pad
short of length and going down the leg side, swivels to pull it behind square leg
fuller and down the leg side, gets away with that one as Dowrich fails to connect the sweep
fuller on the stumps, flicked away towards square leg
length ball on the stumps, whipped towards short midwicket
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, comes forward and punches it towards mid-on
pitched up around off, comes forward and blocks
short of length around off, stays beside the line and blocks
short of length outside off, looks to punch but ends up chopping it into the off side
fuller on the stumps, flicked away but straight towards short midwicket
short of length outside off, punched towards cover from the back foot
length ball on the stumps, not much turn on this one. Goes back and defends
too full outside off, and Brooks doesn't miss out, drives it through covers for four
too full on middle and leg, Brooks jams his bat at it
length ball outside off, a googly this time, Brooks leaves it alone

looked close but maybe the height was an issue. Another googly. A length ball around off, Brooks looks to defend with bat and pad close but misses and is struck on the pad. A loud appeal for lbw but denied
a bouncer this time, not seen much of that from him. Dowrich though had no issue in ducking under
length ball around off, looks to punch on the off side, gets an inside edge towards deep backward square leg
another bouncer, just around off stump, Brooks too ducks under it
length ball in the corridor, comes forward before shouldering arms
length ball but straying down the leg side, goes for the flick but misses but the ball brushes the pads and beats the diving Zazai
length ball at the stumps, defends it towards mid-on
a googly but doing down the leg side, Dowrich is late on the flick but gets two leg-byes
a wrong'un again. Lunges forward and smothers it
a legbreak and Dowrich goes for the sweep. Misses as the ball lobs towards short fine leg off the pad
googly once again, short of length at middle and leg, flicks it towards midwicket
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards cover-point
length ball outside off, pushes it away from the body, towards cover
length ball outside off, stays back and punches it through covers, finds the gap. Beats the diving cover and the chasing extra cover for four
fuller at the stumps, presents the full face of the bat but Ahmadzai makes the stop in his followthrough
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
length ball around off, stays back and defends it on the off side
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
slower, fuller and at the stumps, Brooks bunts it down
length ball on the stumps, flicked away but cannot beat the short midwicket
short of length at the stumps, goes back and pulls but doesn't get it from the middle of the bat. Was a wrong'un too. A single towards backward square leg
length ball around off, stays back and blocks
a full toss around off, fails to capitalise on it, hits it straight towards mid-on
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards the bowler
fuller on middle, flicks it towards the right of mid-on but cannot beat the fielder
good short ball, surprising the batsman who reacts late but manages to duck under
length ball on the pads, flicked towards deep midwicket
length ball around off, defends it from the back foot
short of length outside off, stays away from the line of the ball
length ball around off, whipped in front of square leg
length ball around off, goes back, waits for it to turn and defends
drifting on the pads this time, Brooks misses the flick
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, lunges forward and dead-bats it
fuller at the stumps, Brooks was on the back foot but does well to bring his bat down in time
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller and wider, a big stride forward to slap it away, straight towards extra cover

and there's the much-needed breakthrough. A touch fuller around off and middle, Dowrich plants his front foot forward and looks to defend around his pads. But the ball spins back and hits him on the pads, just below the knee roll. No doubt about that
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball on middle and leg, looks for the flick but misses and is struck on the pad. Another appeal for lbw but this was clearly heading down
wrong 'un, and almost gets him. Length ball around off, Holder was stuck in his crease, gets an outside edge but it lands just short of first slip
length ball at the stumps from wide of the crease. Defends back towards the bowler
fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards mid-on
fuller around off, drives it towards mid-off and hares down towards the other end
fuller outside off, throws his bat at it, the ball goes towards point
length ball around off, looks to defend, an inside edge towards short fine leg
tossed up to the batsman, a big stride forward from Holder as he dispatches it over the bowler's head
length ball on the pads, flicks it away towards backward square leg
fuller and wider outside off, drives it towards extra cover
a googly from outside leg, tucked away towards short fine leg
fuller on the stumps and very straight drive, bisecting the two fielders at long-off and long-on
short of length outside off, goes back and punches it towards deep extra cover

Zahir Khan is already celebrating but umpire Nitin Menon is unmoved. Length ball on middle and leg and spinning further down, beats the bat to hit on the back leg. a huge appeal for lbw but that was clearly going down
length ball around off, defended from the front foot
fuller this time, comes forward and defends again
length ball around off, stays back and blocks
length ball on the pads, goes for the flick but misses. Another appeal denied
short of length outside off, punched towards the left of the bowler who makes a diving stop
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
flighted around middle, and he looks to drive. Gets it off the inside part of the bat towards mid-wicket
short of a length, and he hangs back and plays this towards extra cover. Sweeper there gets to it, but cannot prevent two
length ball, a bit of sharp bounce back, and he plays it towards mid-wicket and sets off for a quick single. Easy in teh end
flights this around off, turns it back in, and beats the outside edge as Brooks stretches to defend
plays this deftly wide of cover and sets off for a single
hangs back and drives this through covers. Top shot!
defends a length ball around off
length ball, defends it stretching forward
stretches forward to defend

appeal for a stumping, and they have sent this upstairs! Hamza tosses this up around off, and Holder stretches forward to meet it, and Zazai is quick to whip the bails off. The question is where is Holder's back foot? It's in the air and hasn't been plonked back in time before Zazai can do his glovework. Top wicket! Good keeping to complement what was originally a clever variation from Hamza - a delivery with some extra revs on it and it just evaded Holder's blade as he sought to defend it
short of a length, and he goes back to drive this towards long-off
length, close to off-stump, as he hangs back and tries to drive. Beats the outside edge!
length, and this has turned and bounced significantly! Grin on Rashid's face as that goes way past Brooks, who was rooted on the back foot
almost a carbon copy of the previous ball, as Brooks let this spin past him
straighter, and he defends, pressing forward
short ball, and Brooks puts this away. Goes on to the back foot and gets this behind square with ease. Into the 90s!
googly, starts from outside off, and he lets this pass
flighted, fuller around off, and he drives this towards deep cover. Easy single
length, a bit of turn, and also keeps low, as it goes across Brooks. Smartly played, as he keeps bat close to body and lets it go through
length, down the pads and he flicks this away towards square leg
drives one back to the bowler
defends a length ball around middle and leg
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length, goes back to drive, and it's intercepted by the bowler himself
length, and he defends from the crease
short, and he goes back and cuts this past point. Will be pulled up ahead of the boundary
shorter, and he goes back to cut. The ball doesn't turn as much as hoped, in fact, a bit of turn back into him, cramps him for room. Cuts towards point
length, turns back in, and he drives back towards the bowler
stretches forward to meet a length ball around off, and the spin beats the outside edge!
fuller, wider, and he has got this towards deep point. Will take him to 99!
length, angles into his pads, and he pushes this towards long-on
length, and he defends from the crease as the ball straightens after pitching on leg and middle
slower through the air, towards middle and off, and he allows it to come to him, stretching forward, to defend
length, and he drives this from the crease towards mid-on
drives to mid-on off the back foot

short, wide, and he goes back and lays some bat on it to get it to the right of point. Sets off immediately, and completes his first Test ton! Takes his helmet off to acknowledge the applause of a sparse crowd, and his team mates. Vital innings, this
length, around off, and he defends
shorter, and he goes back and punches this past the bowler towards deep mid-off
tossed up around off, and Cornwall has a go at this! Not in complete control, as he skews this towards extra cover. Wanted to go straighter for sure

Rashid has another! Fired in quicker, and Cornwal plays from the crease. Given out leg before, and Cornwall can't believe it. There's an inside edge on to the pad, though it was straight as deliveries go. Doesn't matter...no DRS here for the West Indies batsman. Afghanistan continue to chip away in this fascinating contest
another quicker, flatter one. Strikes him on the pad, but he stretches forward and gets struck on the pad. Hit outside the line, though
defends a length ball fired into him
length, and he presses forward to defend
great ball! Fired in from wide of the crease, and this one has been let rip. Turns across Brooks, but he again plays close to his body and is happy to be beaten outside off
defends from the crease
fuller, and he drives this with a stretch forward towards mid-on
stretches to meet a ball well outside off. Hits pad, and Hamza appeals, but the impact was well outside off
stretches to defend a length ball around middle and off
short of a length, and he goes back and drives this firmly through the extra cover region. There's a sweeper there, but he has no chance
defends a length ball
length, and he whips this off his pads and picks up two
defends a length ball pressing forward
whips a quicker one fired in at his pads towards square leg
presses forward to defend a length ball
length ball, and he goes back and drives it back towards the bowler

DROPPED! A very tough chance, though, for Zazai, as Brooks slashes at one turning across him. Gets the outside edge, and Zazai parries it, and slip also cannot latch on to it. Runs away towards third man
length, and he defends from the crease
presses forward to defend a length ball

got him this time! Length ball, tossed from wide of the crease, and this was the one that went on with the arm. Brooks looks to go big towards mid-wicket, and perhaps for the first time in this beautiful innings of his, he loses shape, and is punished for it
tossed up around off, and he drives this back towards the bowler
length, outside off, and he presses forward to defend. Appeal for leg before, but the impact would have been outside off
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
googly, from outside off, and strikes him on the pads as he stretches forward. Not given, as impact was again probably outside off
full stretch to meet another length ball around off. Spins past his edge, and is collected by Zazai, who just has to appeal, doesn't he!
fired down the leg side, and he gets some glove on to this to run it away towards fine leg
down leg side again, and he plays this towards short fine leg. No chance to get runs though
length, outside off, and Warrican stretches forward to defend but is beaten with the turn away from him
stretches forward to defend
length, and he plays from the crease. Driven back towards the bowler
floated around off stump, and he comes forward to defend
short, and he hangs back and smacks this through the cover region. Goes to the sweeper, and they are happy to take the single on offer
length, presses forward to defend
length, towards the leg stump, and Warrican has done well to flick this away towards mid-wicket
length, spins across him after he stretches forward. Another appeal for a caught-behind, but not given
wrong 'un, and he goes back and plays with the turn towards fine leg
short, and he hangs back and flicks it towards square leg
sharp, quick turn away from Roach, who stretches forward but cannot meet this ball. Played with bat close to body
beaten outside off, with sharp turn away from him. Another stifled appeal from the Afghans
length, straightens after pitching around leg and middle, and he presses forward to defend
sharp turn from wide of the crease, but the length is short enough to allow Warrican to punch it towards point. They set off for a single immediately and get that run

it's five on debut for Amir Hamza! Gets one to straighten from a length, and Roach stretches to play it with a forward defensive, but plays outside the line of the ball. It goes on to hit his front pad, with not enough of a stride forward to create much doubt in the mind of the umpire.
short, and wide, and Ibrahim can just watch this sail through, to the right of Dowrich behind the stumps
length, a bit outside off, and he plays it towards the slips cordon
length, outside off, and he leaves
length, angles in, and he defends from the crease
length, and he defends from the crease
presses forward to defend one around off
fuller around off, looks to defend, gets an inside edge on to his leg
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball around off, looks to defend but almost gets squared up, a thick outside edge towards gully
length ball around off, comes forward and defends
fuller around off, looks to defend but gets a thick outside edge between gully and backward point
much better from Ahmadi, fuller once again from Holder and Ahmadi defends it towards point
full, angling in towards the batsman, defended
length ball in the corridor, left alone
fuller on the stumps, drives it gently towards mid-off
fuller outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards cover
short of length around off, defended towards cover
short of length outside off, punches it behind point from the back foot
length ball around off, defended on the off side
length ball angling down, Ahmadi misses the flick and is rapped on the pads. An appeal for lbw but denied. Height too was an issue
a streaky boundary. A length ball outside off, looks to defend with hard hands, a thick outside edge beats the diving gully fielder to his left
length ball outside off, in the corridor, left alone
length ball in the channel once again, shouldered arms
fuller outside off, pushes at it and gets a couple to deep point
fuller around off, leans into the forward defence
length ball outside off, looks to poke at it but gets beaten
and again! Another length ball outside off, Zadran need not play at those but he pushes at it and misses
